odata.nextLink.title: The URL to get the next set of results.

value.title: The list of applications available in the account.

applicationId.title: The id of the application to deploy.

version.title: The version of the application to deploy. If omitted, the default version is deployed.

id.title: A string that uniquely identifies the application within the account.

autoPoolIdPrefix.description: The prefix can be up to 20 characters long.
autoPoolIdPrefix.title: A prefix to be added to the unique identifier when a pool is automatically created.

keepAlive.title: Whether to keep an auto pool alive after its lifetime expires.

pool.title: The pool specification for the auto pool.

poolLifetimeOption.title: The minimum lifetime of created auto pools, and how multiple jobs on a schedule are assigned to pools.

AutoPoolSpecification.title: Specifies characteristics for a temporary 'auto pool'. The Batch service will create this auto pool when the job is submitted.

error.title: Details of the error encountered evaluating the autoscale formula on the pool, if the evaluation was unsuccessful.

results.description: Each variable value is returned in the form $variable=value, and variables are separated by semicolons.
results.title: The final values of all variables used in the evaluation of the autoscale formula.

timestamp.title: The time at which the autoscale formula was last evaluated.

AutoScaleRun.title: The results and errors from an execution of a pool autoscale formula.

code.title: An identifier for the autoscale error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.title: A message describing the autoscale error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

values.title: A list of additional error details related to the autoscale error.

AutoScaleRunError.title: An error that occurred when executing or evaluating a pool autoscale formula.

code.title: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.title: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

values.title: A collection of key-value pairs containing additional details about the error.

BatchError.title: An error response received from the Azure Batch service.

key.title: An identifier specifying the meaning of the Value property.

value.title: The additional information included with the error response.

BatchErrorDetail.title: An item of additional information included in an Azure Batch error response.

Certificate.description: A certificate that can be installed on compute nodes and can be used to authenticate operations on the machine.

deleteCertificateError.description: This property is set only if the certificate is in the DeleteFailed state.
deleteCertificateError.title: The error that occurred on the last attempt to delete this certificate.

previousState.description: This property is not set if the certificate is in its initial Active state.
previousState.title: The previous state of the certificate.

previousStateTransitionTime.description: This property is not set if the certificate is in its initial Active state.
previousStateTransitionTime.title: The time at which the certificate entered its previous state.

publicData.title: The public part of the certificate as a base-64 encoded .cer file.

state.title: The current state of the certificate.

stateTransitionTime.title: The time at which the certificate entered its current state.

thumbprint.title: The X.509 thumbprint of the certificate. This is a sequence of up to 40 hex digits (it may include spaces but these are removed).

thumbprintAlgorithm.title: The algorithm used to derive the thumbprint. This must be sha1.

exitCode.description: This parameter is returned only if the task is in the completed state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.
